rationales.universalism: She argues for protecting care access for migrant workers who cannot afford fees.

rationales.benevolence: She recognizes she is neglecting her daughter's needs by repeatedly deprioritizing family time.
rationales.universalism: She chooses to cover refugee English classes to support vulnerable families.
She centers climate harm and collective responsibility, and cites personal pro-environment choices.
She preserves free services for patients unable to pay, even under severe budget constraints.

rationales.hedonism: She works through a holiday instead of choosing personal comfort or leisure.
rationales.universalism: She spends Christmas Eve serving migrant families and focuses on broader social welfare.

rationales.benevolence: Her work choice causes her to miss her daughter's dance, straining close family relationships.
She downplays her daughters' emotional needs while prioritizing external obligations.
rationales.universalism: She insists on continuing refugee language support to reduce exploitation and deportation risk.

rationales.hedonism: She intentionally disconnects from work and enjoys a restorative afternoon at the park.
rationales.benevolence: She prioritizes focused, affectionate time with her daughters.

rationales.universalism: She accepts a fairness critique about management pay, signaling concern for equitable treatment of staff.

rationales.security: She voluntarily reduces household income, increasing financial strain at home.
rationales.benevolence: She makes a unilateral family-finance decision despite anticipating harm to family relationships.
rationales.universalism: She takes a personal pay cut to protect a staff position on fairness grounds.
